div.head: The verdit of the Booke, made in fourme of a Dialougue, beetweene the Booke and the Bookes friende.

sp.speaker: F
sp.l: VVhat, dost thou think al sorts of men to please?

sp.speaker: B
sp.l: Nay, hard it is for one to please ech whight.

sp.speaker: F
sp.l: VVhat men are those, whom thou sonest disease?

sp.speaker: B
sp.l: Al fauting fooles, that seeke to work their spight
Through taunting tongues & scofs, & do delight
VVith wresting wits to turn things frō the right.

sp.speaker: F
sp.l: VVhy was thou made? what is thy chief intent?

sp.speaker: B
sp.l: To please the best of purpose I am sent.

sp.speaker: F
sp.l: Go forth therfore, the best will thee imbrace.

sp.speaker: B
sp.l: Then feare I not abrod to shew my face,
Nor for il tongues that would me faine degrace.
